xxl.core.io

Class XXLFilesystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.io.XXLFilesystem

  • public class XXLFilesystem
extends Object
    Creates a simple raw device filesystem or connects to an existing filesystem.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected File df
      Dummy file which is needed.
      protected FilesystemOperations fso
      Object which allows modifications on files on the file system.

      Is it a native raw device?
      protected RawAccess ra
      RawAccess object

      Name of the raw device (or path)

      Creates a filesystem based on a raw device.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XXLFilesystem

        public XXLFilesystem(boolean nativeRawDevice,
                     int blockSize,
                     int sizeOfRawDevice,
                     String rawDeviceName,
                     int[] partitions,
                     String[] fileNames,
                     int seekExponent,
                     boolean doStatistics,
                     boolean createFiles,
                     boolean initBlocksAtEOF)
        Creates a filesystem based on a raw device.
        Parameters:
        nativeRawDevice - Is it a native raw device?
        blockSize - The block size
        sizeOfRawDevice - The size of the raw device (if it is not a native raw device)
        rawDeviceName - Name of the raw device (or path)
        partitions - Size of each file on the static filesystem.
        fileNames - Name of the files on the static filesystem.
        seekExponent - Performs a sector mapping so that a seek of size 2^seekExponent is performed, when going from one sector to the next sector. If 0, then no mapping is performed.
        doStatistics - Gather statistical informations on the main raw access?
        createFiles - Determines if files are already available (false) or new files should overwrite existing data inside the sectors.
        initBlocksAtEOF - Determines iff new space at the end a RandomAccessFile should be initialized will 0-values or not. true is the standard, because it is fully compliant with java.io.RandomAccessFile.

      • XXLFilesystem

        public XXLFilesystem(boolean unbufferedWrite)
        Connects to the normal filesystem using buffered write or not.
        Parameters:
        unbufferedWrite - use unbuffered write (needs java 1.4).
